Renting safely in Bali (questions to ask before deposits)

A parent-first renting guide: verification steps, contract questions, and a staged approach that reduces risk.

#housing#renting#safety#checklist
Pillar: Housing: renting, neighborhoods, and realistic expectations
Housing note
Rental terms and norms vary a lot in Bali. This page shares experience-based guidance for families, not legal advice. Verify contracts, pricing, and terms independently.
Official linksAsk a question
Disclosure
Some links on this site may be partner links. If you choose to contact a partner through our site, we may receive a referral fee at no extra cost to you. We only highlight partners we believe are aligned with families, and we encourage you to do your own due diligence.
Learn more

Quick take

Renting can be straightforward—until it isn’t. The biggest risk isn’t “Bali”; it’s rushed decisions.

If you can: do a short stay first, view in person, verify identity, then sign.

A staged approach (lower stress)

  1. Short stay (7–21 days) in your shortlisted area(s)
  2. View 5–10 places quickly
  3. Verify: owner/agent identity, deposit terms, maintenance expectations
  4. Sign a clear agreement
  5. Move in, then optimize (don’t optimize first)

Questions to ask before deposits

  • Who is the legal owner / manager?
  • What’s the exact deposit amount and refund policy?
  • What happens if utilities fail (water, electricity, internet)?
  • Who pays for repairs, and what’s the response time?

What we learned the hard way

“Perfect” listings disappear. But families who know their top 3 priorities can decide quickly without panic.
